title: spack install llvm fails
body:
`spack install llvm` is failing for me. I have the full output below, but the gist of it is that I get this error:

>   >> 857    CMake Error at /tmp/testnewm/spack-stage/spack-stage-llvm-9.0.1-uyz
>             zpurwqukh3wfeazimpnnelw7h2t4o/spack-src/lldb/docs/CMakeLists.txt:32
>              (get_target_property):
>      858      get_target_property() called with non-existent target "swig_wrapp
>             er".
> 

I'm not very savvy with cmake, so I'm not sure where this swig_wrapper property should be defined. It's also not clear to me who is to blame (i.e., this may be a bug in LLDB's cmake files). I did do some Google searching, and this is related to -DLLDB_DISABLE_PYTHON:Bool=TRUE being defined, which the llvm package defines with the ~python variant. This problem occurs with LLVM version 9.0.0 and 9.0.1, but not with 8.0.0.
 

> [testnewm@opal186 spack]$ ./bin/spack install llvm
> [+] /usr/WS2/testnewm/spack/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-broadwell/gcc-8.1.0/libiconv-1.16-mqkdx7bouqvxtv3vnsv5wbznqxjayixq
